name: 微生物生態與多樣性
description: It is hard to understand an ecosystem without understanding the metabolism of microorganisms living there. The main aim of this course to lead students to know the background knowledge of microbial diversity and the relevant research fields, including the phylogenetic and functional diversity of eukaryotic and prokaryotic microorganisms, metagenomics, microbial physiology and metabolism, biogeochemistry, and oceanography. The techniques and approaches related to microbial ecology have been significantly advanced in the past decade; thus, the relevant tools will be introduced in the course. Moreover, the oral presentation and discussion of students will be the important parts in this course that will facilitate students to have more understanding of microbial diversity.
goals: Learn about the background of microbial ecology, including microbial diversity, evolution, physiology and metabolism, biogeochemistry and oceanography.
Study classical and emerging techniques related to microbial ecology.
syllabus:
Week 1. Bacterial diversity

Week 2. Archaeal diversity

Week 3. Algal diversity

Week 4. Fungal diversity

Week 5. Microbe-host interactions

Week 6. Functional diversity of microorganisms

Week 7. Biogeochemistry and biodegradation

Week 8. Isolation and cultivation of microorganisms

Week 9. Genomics of microorganisms

Week 10. Metagenomics

Week 11~16. Oral presentation and discussion of students

methodologies.note: The introduction of the background knowledge of microbial diversity and the relevant research fields, including the phylogenetic and functional diversity of microorganisms, metagenomics, microbial physiology and metabolism, biogeochemistry, and oceanography.
Oral presentation and discussion of students
